findings.title: A floating pragma is set (SWC-103)
findings.description: The Solidity version used in the contract is not fixed, which can lead to unexpected behavior and security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Owner Can Transfer Funds from Contract Divided by 2 to Funds Address
findings.description: The contract owner can transfer funds from the contract divided by 2 to the funds address.

findings.title: Users can withdraw their own tokens if finalized state is false
findings.description: Users are able to withdraw their own tokens when the finalization state is set to false.

findings.title: Unprotected SELFDESTRUCT Instruction
findings.description: The contract contains an unprotected SELFDESTRUCT instruction, which can lead to unintended destruction of the contract.

findings.title: Unprotected Ether Withdrawal
findings.description: The contract allows direct withdrawal of ether without any protection or access control.

findings.title: Function Default Visibility
findings.description: Functions with default visibility can lead to unintended access and manipulation of contract state.
